content.name: chair
content.label: Sitting Furniture
content.gloss: furniture that is designed for sitting on

content.name: chair_head
content.label: Chair Head
content.gloss: a support that you can rest your head on while sitting

content.name: headrest
content.label: Head Rest
content.gloss: a surface part on chair head for a sitting human to rest the head on

content.name: head_connector
content.label: Head Connector
content.gloss: a part that connects the chair head to the other part of chair, usually chair back

content.name: chair_back
content.label: Chair Back
content.gloss: a support at the back of the chair that you can lean against while sitting

content.name: back_surface
content.label: Back Surface
content.gloss: a surface part for a sitting person to lean the back on. It includes sub-parts such as back hard surface, back soft surface, back surface vertical bar, back surface horizontal bar, back surface slant bar, back surface complex decoration, etc.

content.name: back_frame
content.label: Back Frame
content.gloss: a framing part to outline the backbone of a chair back. It includes sub-parts such as back framing vertical bars, back framing horizontal bars, back framing slant bars, back holistic frames, etc.

content.name: back_hard_surface
content.label: Back Hard Surface
content.gloss: a front surface part on chair back for a sitting human to lean the back on. It is usually made of wood/metal/plastic or other hard materials.

content.name: back_soft_surface
content.label: Back Soft Surface
content.gloss: a front surface part on chair back for a sitting human to lean the back on. It is usually made of leather/fabric/soft stuffs.

content.name: back_support
content.label: Back Support
content.gloss: a part behind the back surface that supports the back surface. It is different from back frame in that the back support is for supporting the back surface while the back frame is for framing the backbone/outline of a chair back.

content.name: back_holistic_frame
content.label: Back Holistic Frame
content.gloss: a framing structure for chair back that is usually curved, continuous and indivisible into smaller bars/strips

content.name: back_surface_vertical_bar
content.label: Back Surface Vertical Bar
content.gloss: a near-vertical bar/strip like part that help form the back surface

content.name: back_surface_horizontal_bar
content.label: Back Surface Horizontal Bar
content.gloss: a near-horizontal bar/strip like part that help form the back surface

content.name: back_surface_slant_bar
content.label: Back Surface Slant Bar
content.gloss: a slant bar/strip like part that help form the back surface. The angle between a slant bar and the ground should be around 30~60 degree. Otherwise, it should be annotated as either vertical or horizontal bars.

content.name: back_frame_vertical_bar
content.label: Back Frame Vertical Bar
content.gloss: a near-vertical bar/strip like part that help form the back frame

content.name: back_frame_horizontal_bar
content.label: Back Frame Horizontal Bar
content.gloss: a near-horizontal bar/strip like part that help form the back frame

content.name: back_frame_slant_bar
content.label: Back Frame Slant Bar
content.gloss: a slant bar/strip like part that help form the back frame. The angle between a slant bar and the ground should be around 30~60 degree. Otherwise, it should be annotated as either vertical or horizontal bars.

content.name: back_complex_decoration
content.label: Back Complex Decoration
content.gloss: a complex decorative part for chair back that does not belong to simple bars/strips, frames or surfaces. It usually comes with some complicated geometry and artistic design for decorative purposes.

content.name: back_connector
content.label: Back Connector
content.gloss: a part that connects the chair back to the other part of chair, usually chair seat or chair base

content.name: chair_arm
content.label: Chair Arm
content.gloss: the part of an armchair or sofa that supports the elbow and forearm of a seated person

content.name: armrest_hard_surface
content.label: Armrest Hard Surface
content.gloss: a part that supports your elbow and forearm, usually made of wood/metal/plastic or other hard materials

content.name: armrest_soft_surface
content.label: Armrest Soft Surface
content.gloss: a part that supports your elbow and forearm, usually made of leather/fabric/airbag and stuffed with soft material

content.name: arm_horizontal_bar
content.label: Arm Horizontal Bar
content.gloss: a near-horizontal bar/strip like part that supports the armrest. It usually connects to the chair back to support the armrest.

content.name: arm_vertical_bar
content.label: Arm Vertical Bar
content.gloss: a near-vertical bar/strip like part that supports the armrest. It usually connects to the chair seat/base to support the armrest.

content.name: arm_slant_bar
content.label: Arm Slant Bar
content.gloss: a slant bar/strip like part that composes the arm surface/support. The angle between a slant bar and the ground should be around 30~60 degree. Otherwise, the part should be annotated as either vertical or horizontal bar.

content.name: arm_holistic_frame
content.label: Arm Holistic Frame
content.gloss: a continuous framing and supporting part that supports the armrest.  It is difficult for this part to be further divided into smaller armrest and vertical bars.

content.name: arm_sofa_style
content.label: Sofa-style Arm
content.gloss: a big chunk of geometry that supports human's arm and is usually connected to chair back or chair seat seamlessly. It is commonly used for sofas and some bean chairs. You can think of the part as an imaginary part from a continuous single part that acts as chair back, seat and arms.

content.name: arm_writing_table
content.label: Arm Writing Table
content.gloss: an arm of a tablet-armed chair; widened to provide a writing surface

content.name: arm_connector
content.label: Arm Connector
content.gloss: a part that connects the chair arm to the other part of chair, usually chair seat or chair base

content.name: chair_seat
content.label: Chair Seat
content.gloss: any support where you can sit (especially the part of a chair or bench etc. on which you sit)

content.name: seat_surface
content.label: Seat Surface
content.gloss: a top surface part on a chair seat for a person to sit on. It includes several sub-parts such as seat hard surface, seat soft surface, seat surface vertical bar, seat surface horizontal bar, seat surface slant bar, etc.

content.name: seat_support
content.label: Seat Support
content.gloss: a big chunk of geometry under the seat surface that supports the seat surface. It usually exists for a sofa chair. This is different from base connector, which is a part that connects the seat and the base.

content.name: seat_frame
content.label: Seat Frame
content.gloss: a framing structure to construct the backbone/frame of a chair seat. It includes several sub-parts such as frame vertical bars, frame horizontal bars, frame slant bars, seat holistic frame, etc.

content.name: seat_hard_surface
content.label: Seat Hard Surface
content.gloss: a top surface part on chair seat for a sitting human to sit on. It is usually made of wood/metal/plastic or other hard materials.

content.name: seat_soft_surface
content.label: Seat Soft Surface
content.gloss: a top surface part on chair seat for a sitting human to sit on. It is usually made of leather/fabric/soft stuffs.

content.name: seat_surface_vertical_bar
content.label: Seat Surface Vertical Bar
content.gloss: a near-vertical bar/strip like part that composes the seat surface. A bar is considered as vertical if it is close to perpendicular to chair back.

content.name: seat_surface_horizontal_bar
content.label: Seat Surface Horizontal Bar
content.gloss: a near-horizontal bar/strip like part that composes the seat surface. A bar is considered as horizontal if it is close to parallel to chair back.

content.name: seat_surface_slant_bar
content.label: Seat Surface Slant Bar
content.gloss: a slant bar/strip like part that composes the seat surface. The angle between a slant bar and the chair back should be around 30~60 degree. Otherwise, the part should be annotated as either vertical or horizontal bars.

content.name: seat_frame_vertical_bar
content.label: Seat Frame Vertical Bar
content.gloss: a near-vertical bar/strip like part that composes the seat frame. A bar is considered as vertical if it is close to perpendicular to chair back.

content.name: seat_frame_horizontal_bar
content.label: Seat Frame Horizontal Bar
content.gloss: a near-horizontal bar/strip like part that composes the seat frame. A bar is considered as horizontal if it is close to parallel to chair back.

content.name: seat_frame_slant_bar
content.label: Seat Frame Slant Bar
content.gloss: a slant bar/strip like part that composes the seat frame. The angle between a slant bar and the chair back should be around 30~60 degree. Otherwise, the part should be annotated as either vertical or horizontal bars.

content.name: seat_holistic_frame
content.label: Seat Holistic Frame
content.gloss: a framing structure for chair seat that is usually curved, continuous and indivisible into smaller bars/strips

content.name: pillow
content.label: Pillow
content.gloss: an additional/removable cushion to support the head of a sleeping person, or to support the back or hip of a sitting person. Common types of pillow include rectangular pillow, circular pillow, donut pillow, etc.

content.name: footrest
content.label: Footrest
content.gloss: a object (often separate) to support the leg and foot of a sitting person while they are seating in the main chair.  Sometimes also called an ottoman

content.name: footrest_connector
content.label: Footrest Connector
content.gloss: a part that connects the footrest to the other parts of chair, usually the chair seat or chair base

content.name: chair_base
content.label: Chair Base
content.gloss: a support or foundation for chair. It includes but is not limited to leg base, swivel base, pedestal base, foot base, etc.

content.name: regular_leg_base
content.label: Regular Leg Base
content.gloss: a chair base that is composed of several vertical leg-like supporting sub-parts, possibly with several connections between legs, and contacts the ground by the legs, some horizontal bars or the foot/caster structure on the legs

content.name: bar_stretcher
content.label: Bar Stretcher
content.gloss: a supporting part joining the legs that is of bar/strip like shape

content.name: circular_stretcher
content.label: Circular Stretcher
content.gloss: a supporting part joining the legs that is of circular shape

content.name: runner
content.label: Runner
content.gloss: horizontal part that connects the end of legs and contacts the ground

content.name: rocker
content.label: Rocker
content.gloss: a curved support that permits the supported object to rock to and from

content.name: seat_connector
content.label: Seat Connector
content.gloss: a part that connects the chair base to the chair seat

content.name: star_leg_base
content.label: Star-shape Leg Base
content.gloss: a chair base that includes a star-shape leg structure. Each leg of the star leg structure is near-horizontal to the ground plane.

content.name: central_support
content.label: Central Support
content.gloss: a central supporting part that connects the chair seat and the chair legs/pedestal bases. It often occurs in office chairs and pedestal chairs. Please annotate each central supports individually if there are many.

content.name: mechanical_control
content.label: Mechanical Control
content.gloss: a complex mechanical control part that is often used to lift the chair central cylinder or to swivel the chair. Just label one holistic part for each control unit. There is no need to label the mechanical details. Please use the option other to label the part we do not include in the list.

content.name: lever
content.label: Lever
content.gloss: a rigid bar pivoted about a fulcrum

content.name: knob
content.label: Knob
content.gloss: a round handle

content.name: button
content.label: Button
content.gloss: an electrical switch operated by pressing

content.name: mounting_plate
content.label: Mounting Plane
content.gloss: a sheet of metal or wood or glass or plastic

content.name: footrest_ring
content.label: Footrest Ring
content.gloss: a ring-shape part that is designed to support human feet, mounted on the central supports and on top of the chair legs

content.name: footrest_bar
content.label: Footrest Bar
content.gloss: a bar-shape part on footrest

content.name: footrest_circular
content.label: Footrest Circle
content.gloss: a circular part on footrest

content.name: pedestal_base
content.label: Pedestal Base
content.gloss: a chair base that includes a big pedestal part that contacts with the ground

content.name: pedestal
content.label: Pedestal
content.gloss: a big chunk of geometry that contacts the ground to stablize the chair

content.name: foot_base
content.label: Foot Base
content.gloss: a chair base that contacts the ground via foots/casters. There is no long vertical leg in the base.

content.name: short_leg
content.label: Short Leg
content.gloss: a very short leg that connects the chair seat and the chair foot/wheels

content.name: surface_base
content.label: Surface Base
content.gloss: a chair base that contacts the ground with some big area. There could be some vertical leg parts.

content.name: ground_surface
content.label: Ground Surface
content.gloss: a board-like part that touches the ground totally

content.name: side_surface
content.label: Side Surface
content.gloss: a board-like part that supports the chair

content.name: star_leg_set
content.label: Star-shape Leg Set
content.gloss: a star shape structure that contains many legs and the correlated foots or casters

content.name: leg
content.label: Leg
content.gloss: one of the supports for a piece of furniture

content.name: foot
content.label: Foot
content.gloss: a support resembling a pedal extremity

content.name: caster
content.label: Wheel Assembly
content.gloss: a pivoting roller attached to the bottom of furniture or trucks or portable machines to make them movable

content.name: brake
content.label: Brake
content.gloss: a restraint used to slow or stop a vehicle

content.name: caster_yoke
content.label: Caster Yoke
content.gloss: forked part for connecting wheel to mounting plate

content.name: caster_stem
content.label: Caster Stem
content.gloss: post part of caster rig

content.name: caster_mounting_plate
content.label: Mounting Plate
content.gloss: a sheet of metal or wood or glass or plastic

content.name: wheel
content.label: Wheel
content.gloss: a simple machine consisting of a circular frame with spokes (or a solid disc) that can rotate on a shaft or axle (as in vehicles or other machines)
